ovdesc.p: A drawing under a facility could be in any allowed currency under the facility. The drawing could also be made by any allowed customer defined in the facility. At the time of each drawing checks are performed by the system to ensure that the drawing complies with the terms defined at the facility and tranche level.

Facility is available to the user to input amount of drawing in the drawing currency or base currency equivalent. Further features such as exchange rate fixing and interest rate fixing for forward dated drawings are also available.

Each drawing is identified against the tranche under which it is drawn and the individual participant's share in the tranche is updated by the system automatically. The share of participants in the drawing is defaulted by the system with an option to change the participant shares, if so required. The amounts due from individual participant at the time of drawdown and due to the individual participant on maturity is held and processed by the system automatically. Liquidation of amounts due from the borrower could follow an automatic route or through an internal account. If automatic route is chosen, on the due date the amounts due to individual participant is distributed. If internal option is chosen, distribution of funds to the participants could be done after the borrower has settled the dues. Separate front ends are available for settlement of dues after the liquidation date.

Loans under syndication can be input with a value date that is less than today. However this can be done only in cases when it otherwise satisfies the normal input conditions of a Loan, viz., Validity of the Tranche under question, availability of funds under the Tranche, within the exposure level of each of the participants, etc. Impact of limit line and collection of any charges attached to this would be done as on the date of input of such a backdated Loan. In the case of commitment fee, the recalculation would be done for the current schedule.

To cater to instances such as undrawn commitment amount under the Tranche is less than the loan amount although the Tranche is live, the user has the option of input of SL.BUY.SELL, for Principal Movements that are backdated as well.

Principal Increase/Decrease in an existing undiscounted loan is permitted during the Tenor ranging between the value date and the maturity date of the Loan. The movement input shall however not conflict with the SL.EXPOSURE.LEVEL.

For Principal reduction, new participants would not be permitted, but such a decrease could result in exit of a participant. For Principal increase, new participants would be permitted provided such a participant is already recorded in the Tranche and has adequate share to participate.

If the loan were in a currency different from that of the Facility, then the impact of the Principal movements in the Facility would happen at the historic rate. Any adjustment of interest and commitment fee on account such principal movements would be confined to the current schedule only.

Reversal function is restricted even if one schedule has been processed (or) Charges exist for the loan contract. In such cases where charges exist, reversal of charges should be done first before reversing the loan contract.

Identifies the manner in which overdue payments are handled. The default for all contracts is AUTOMATIC.
Two options are provided;

AUTOMATIC - On maturity of the loans (or while processing schedules), accounting entries would be passed across the liquidation account for the entire dues and the respective participant's share would be disbursed through their Nostro accounts automatically. In this scenario, the Agent expects funds to be credited to his Nostro on the due dates and hence automates the liquidation and disbursement entries.

INTERNAL - In this scenario the Agent would pay the participants only on actual receipt of funds in his Nostro/liquidation account. The Agent's share (in case the Agent is also a participant) would be liquidated to the account provided in the deal for the respective due but no amounts would be disbursed to the participants. The overdue amounts would get captured in SL.OD.DUES and SL.OD.PART files. On receipt of funds, the application SL.OD.DUES may be used to pay off the participant's share as well as to reverse out own share in the internal account where Agent's share is stored.

In case the borrower has followed a different method of rounding with that compared to the Agent, the participant's share of interest, commitment fee and tax on both could differ. In such scenario the borrower would remit an amount different to the one calculated and stored by the Agent in his overdue files. Hence an application SL.ROUND.ADJ has been provided where the Agent could re-allocate the share of interest, commitment fee and tax thereon between the participants, to be in line with the borrower's calculation. This front-end could also be used in case the Agent does a skimming of the interest (on loans) or commitment fee. In this case the borrower is charged a different rate than the one quoted by the participants and the Agent skims the difference.
Liquidation mode INTERNAL could hence be used where ;
(a) The agent would repay the participants only on sighting the funds
(b) Where the agent would require to do rounding adjustments to re-allocate the participant's share
Only allowed values are AUTOMATIC and INTERNAL

While granting forward dated loans in a currency other than the facility currency, the exchange rate at which the drawing would get converted to base currency equivalent would be determined few days before the value date. Such date is input in this field.

A tentative rate is provided in Base.Ccy.Conv field that would be used for updation of facility and limit. On the exchange rate fixing date, the final rate is provided by the user. This rate would be used to update the facility and limit and the earlier updations dropped.
Ex. Facility is for USD 100,000 and Loan is granted for GBP 10,000 on 01JAN02 with following inputs
Value date = 12JAN02, Base.Ccy.Conv = 1.40, Excg.Fix.Dt 10JAN02

On 01st Jan the initial rate of 1.40 would be used and the commitment available amount would get reduced by 14,000 (10,000 * 1.40) to stand at 86,000. On 10th Jan the final rate provided in Excg.Fix.Dt is 1.5. Now this rate would be used to update the facility and hence the new commitment available amount would be 85,000 ie. 86,000 + 14,000(updated earlier) - 15,000 (current update of 10,000 * 1.5).
Two entries to LIVECMT asset type would be raised for the above example, one for 15,000 (new value) and one for 14,000 (old value)

While providing the new exchange rate, error would be shown if the new rate results in overdrawing the commitment available amount. On such action, the accounting entries for asset type FORWARDDB would be raised dropping the old amount and raising the new amount. Limit, facility balances and participant balances files will be rebuilt for such change.

This is a system maintained field which indicates the processing status of the contract. During its life cycle within the system a contract will be
in one of three states. These are:
1. FWD - forward
The contract is forward dated and has not yet reached its value date. At this stage no funds have been drawn down and no processing will be
performed until the value date is reached. The contract appears as a contingent entry in the general ledger.
2. CUR - current (live)
The contract has now become "current" or "live". The value date has been passed and the principal drawn down. Interest is being accrued
on the outstanding principal and repayments are in progress. The contract now represents a live credit balance in the general ledger.
3. LIQ - liquidated (matured).
The outstanding principal and interest have been fully repaid and no further processing or amendments are possible.
3 alpha characters either FWD, CUR or LIQ.

When loan is drawn, there could be circumstances when the interest rate is not determinable in advance. The interest rate is agreed/fixed at a date prior to the maturity of the loan, but well after the value date.

In such cases, the bank may accrue interest at a holding rate for the interim period. Once the actual interest rate is defined in the loan contract, the accruals done at the holding rate is dropped and are made at the newly defined interest rate.

The actual interest rate (or key plus spread) could be defined at any date prior to the maturity of the contract. If no such rate is given the interest schedules would be processed at the holding rate only.

If actual interest rate (or key) is provided after one or more interest schedules are processed, the dropping of accruals at holding rate and re-accrual at final rates would be handled only for the current interest period

Field to capture the consideration when a mere participant enters the syndicate buying a portion of the non-contingent share (loan) from one of the existing participants.

A bank that acts as a mere participant could enter the syndicate right at the beginning or during the life of the syndicate by buying the share (or a portion of it) from an existing participant. For the later type, the transaction could involve a premium/discount paid/received by the buying bank.

This field is used to capture the consideration for the transaction. The premium or discount could be either written directly to P&L or amortised over the life of the Loan. The account from which the consideration is paid out is provided in Bs.Settle.Account.

For example - T24 bank enters the syndicate buying a non-contingent portion of 1,000,000 from bank A for a premium of 10,000. In such case field AMOUNT would show 1,000,000 and value to be input in Bs.Consideration field is 1,010,000. The decision to amortise or not is provided in Bs.Amortisation field. The accounting entries that would be raised are
Dr LIVEDB asset type 1,000,000
Dr Amortisation asset type / P&L category * 10,000
Cr Account in Bs.Settle.Account 1,010,000
* Category defined in SL.PARAMETER based on decision to amortise.
In the above instance if the buy happens at a discount of 10,000 the value to be input in Bs.Consideration is (1,000,000 - 10,000) = 990,000

This field holds the 4 digit activity code generated by the system and written in the form SL-....
Each of the 4 digits are arrived at as below :
The first digit indicates the application for which the activity has been generated. Presently it has three values viz. 1 - PRE 2 - FACILITY and 3 - SL.LOAN
The second digit indicates the operation done under each application. Presently it has six values viz. 0 - OTHERS 1 - INPUT 2 - AMENDMENT 3 - NOTICE 4 - CONFIRMATION 5 - REVERSAL

The third digit indicates the component for which the message is being generated viz. Principal or Interest or commitment fee etc. Presently it has five values viz. 0 - OTHERS 1 - PRINCIPAL 2 - COMMITMENT FEE 3 - INTEREST 4 - CHARGES

The fourth digit indicates to whom the message is being generated, whether to the participant or to the borrower or to both. Presently it has three values viz. 1 - PARTICIPANT ONLY 2 - PARTICIPANT AND BORROWER 3 - BORROWER ONLY

For example when a new loan is drawn down and message to be sent to borrower, the activity generated would be SL-3103 meaning 3-LOAN, 1-INPUT, 0-OTHERS(since it involves all components) and 3-BORROWER.
